title: Welcome to the home of the one of a kind.

excerpt.long: We’re the Aggies: the go-getters, change makers, team players and problem solvers. We’re a unique and energetic community built on diverse backgrounds, experiences and expertise; and we're intent on making the world a better place. These are our stories.

“I’ve always had a fascination with science fiction. It’s partly why I chose to study planetary sciences, along with a love of physics and a belief in the likelihood of life beyond our solar system. Sometimes, I feel like I’m starring in a science fiction film. I get to play explorer, researching how large bodies impact planets and result in the unexpected. There is a tremendous feeling of excitement when I discover something new.”
excerpt.medium:
Title:

Professor, Earth and Planetary Sciences

College:

Letters and Science—Mathematical and Physical Sciences

profile-image.alt: One of a Kind: Sarah Stewart

excerpt.long: “Agriculture and food literally touch every single person on earth, and not many people know that it all starts with small-scale farmers. To help them support the world’s food supply, my company created Henlight, a small solar-powered light that uses smart technology to boost poultry egg production by up to 25 percent. The positive response from producers tells me we’re making a difference, and that is rather humbling.”

profile-image.alt: One of a Kind: Edward Silva

excerpt.long: “My love for the ocean began as a kid on my grandfather’s boat, fishing for salmon and crabbing in the Pacific Northwest. Those early experiences with my ‘Papa’ laid the foundation for my career in marine science. At UC Davis, I spent my days aboard a research vessel off the Northern California coast. I examined sediment core samples from the deep sea to understand how marine ecosystems can flourish. I’m hopeful for a future where salmon are crazy abundant in the rivers where I grew up.”
excerpt.medium:
Degree:

Ph.D., Ecology

Title:

Postdoctoral Scholar, Future of Ice Initiative, University of Washington

College:

Biological Sciences

profile-image.alt: One of a Kind: Sarah Moffitt

excerpt.long: “I was a horrible student. One day, my sixth-grade teacher got absolutely fed up with me because I was disrupting the class. Instead of detention, I had to lead the topic discussions for Julie of the Wolves, the book we were reading at the time. Turned out, I loved my ‘punishment.’ A book that had been dreadful for me — and several of my classmates, actually — came alive. I told my teacher that I wanted to teach English literature someday, and she agreed. For the first time in my life, she told my parents that I was an acceptable student.”
excerpt.medium:
Degree:

B.A., English; Cred

Title:

English Teacher, Sem Yeto Satellite High School

Professional School:

School of Education

College:

Letters and Science—Humanities, Arts and Cultural Studies

profile-image.alt: One of a Kind: Dean Shreve '12, '15

excerpt.long: “Playing taiko drums helps me connect with my Japanese heritage. It’s something I’ve always wanted to do, but never had a chance. I was surprised by the physical and mental strength required to create that explosive energy. When I reach the height of a performance, it’s a thrilling experience. I feel incredible.”

profile-image.alt: One of a Kind: Lisa Wolbert
